result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason L Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason L Martinez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason L Martinez was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid on payment plan of $50/month to begin 6/1/15.
JUDGMENT AMENDED TO INCLUDE: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.

Defendant Jason L Martinez in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Christopher Glinski
Preliminary hearing on December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $1,900.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jason L Martinez in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Jason L Martinez in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
